reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Integrated interventions and reducing morbidity through food security, nutrition, health, Education and WASH responses for IDPs and host communities in Lower Shabelle Region

description.narrative: The Integrated package of Education, Food Security, Health, Nutrition ampWASH Project interventions is targeting 28750 (4700 men,6400Men 7450 Boys amp8200 Girls) in 4 districts in Lower Shabelle region Merka, Qoryoley, Kurtunwarey ampWenlaweyn districts, The populations being targeted are IDP's ampVulnerable hosted communities especially families with malnourished children , families with children of school going age. Through this project, Food Security, health , WASH, education ampNutrition activities will be integrated in the sense of Multi sectoral response of the bellow activities in the program Implementation - Food Secruity : Registration of 400 HH of vulnerable IDPs amptransfer 66 USD directly to the beneficiaries phone number for 4 months, the target beneficiaries will the severely ampmoderately acute malnourished children under five. - Nutrition. Strengthening 4 OTP Centers Screening, admitting ampproviding RUFT to 6700 boys, 6900 girls(15%) of severely malnourished lt5 children boys,girls, Provide Vitamin A,deworming,multiple micronutrient ampiron folic tablets to vulnerable lt5 children 6,700 boys, 6,900 girls amp3500 pregnant amplactating women SAM ampMAM cases admitted, Conducts immunization services through static outpatient therapeutic centers as well as the outreach mobile team to ensure under five children were immunized , Conduct community ampoutreach-based IYCF promotion in target project sites, Conduct 16 promotion sessions on nutrition, health amphygiene practices, Maternal child health ampnutrition (MCHN) promotion messages, Provided 5 days training on Nutrition,hygiene amphealth promotion to 50 technical nutrition staff (24 male amp26 female) - health: Supporting 4 health facilities in the 4districts, functional with all the necessary requirements enterms of Human recourse Health Equipment, Laboratory, Pharmacy, but they are working on Voluntary bases amptheir agreement was expired on Dec.17, AYUUB will strength ampproposing for this project for supporting them staff incentives ampSupplies,, Provide basic PHC services including EPI Nutrition ampconsultations of communicable ampnon-communicable to 6700 Boys, 6900 Girls, 1500 Women, 1600 lt1 year of age in IDPs/Host Communities, Access quality integrated health, Nutrition ampWash service by providing safe routine ampsupplementary immunization to 13600 children under the age of five years (6700boys amp6900 girls) ampto 1500 Women of child bearing age including lt1 years through outreach Integrated Emergency response service delivery ampinclude the Service AWD Cholera prevention, holding per month 36 Awareness campaigns ampSocial Mobilizations on AWD Cholera Prevention, childhood illnesses including malaria, pneumonia, diarrhoea ampmeasles, carry out Referral Services support at the delivery cases complicated ampchildren Under five to the Merka hospital ampto the referral service targeting 303 , 2% of the PLW's ampof the children U5 ampproviding Training on emergency preparedness ampresponse. Education: Provide livelihood support through school feeding for three months to drought affected school going children in 5 primary schools targeting 2500 students (1240 girls amp1260 boys) schools (Km50 amp Ayuub schools in Merka, Buulo Mareer in Kurtunwarey, Geywarrow school Qoryoley district, Bakaal school in Wanlaweyn )Give regular monthly incentives to 50 teachers in 5 primary, Provide 3 days Training of Cash Grant Management to 35 School CEC Members in 5, the project will support only exisiting schools affected by the droughts in Merka, Qoryooley, Kurtunwarey ampWanlaweyn districts in Lower Shabelle region. WASH: Rehabilitate of 100 temporary IDPs latrines, distribution of 400 WASH kits benifiting 2350 HHs, , hygiene promotion training ampsessions will be be provided amp construction of 10 semi-permanen
